Try to relax.

post_text: Colonial Heights Public Schools is not aware of any cases involving Legionnaires in our schools. In assessing our facilities, it should be noted that the school system does not presently have cooling towers associated with our HVAC systems serving the school buildings. Cooling towers have been frequently linked as reservoirs which can harbor Legionella bacteria. However, there can be other water sources present in all buildings which can potentially harbor Legionella bacteria. The school system is aware of this concern and we have enhanced our current maintenance programs to ensure we follow the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) to monitor and maintain our HVAC systems and associated plumbing & mechanical systems to reduce the potential for the amplification of Legionella bacterial.
